WRITING.TITLE: Hi guys, just wanted to share my latest finished work

WRITING.TEXT: Hi, your post just made me join r/nofap to try and get myself back. Thank you

Haha I wasn't really going to. and thank you, it's not tooooo hard but can be a struggle to develop the piece to a certain level. It's in oils and is on a wooden panel. I started by doing a single colored underpainting, which means I throw one color on there, light blue in this case and spread it all around the panel. When its even, I will draw out the face and city, etc, with a brush using the same blue. That layer is in gamsol(paint thinner). that's the first layer and usually the hardest for me to get the face accurate. IT's basically a struggle at the beginning to get all the proportions and stuff in the right place. After the drawing layer is done. I let it dry.
about a day later, I can start adding color layers using linseed oil and letting them dry a bit between each one. IF the drawing is in place, the rest is just fun. you can experiment with textures, values, and choosing what to really emphasize in the painting. I built everything up to a certain level in about 2-3 layers and then only focused on the face. as you can see it's more developed. eespecially the eyes. Just spen tthe rest of the time on that. The level of technical finish usually is strongest at the focal point and gets looser as it things move away from the it.
whoops didn't even mean to write that much.
hope you mean phat, if not, I can make her skinnier
Thank you :) oils.
Thank you guys /u/spiralboundcartoons /u/rosy895 and /u/OctorichOstipus . Here is my portfolio incase you would like to see more http://www.ramandipsingh.com

WRITING.TEXT: I did own it, just not in your comment. I admitted to it in all the other people that came after me. I said it was my bad, I made a mistake. Sorry it was just irritating, I am not angry. Thank you
Okay that's cool. I'm human, I made a mistake and learned my lesson. What do you want me to do ? Sit here and cry about it ? go waste your time hounding someone else.
I said it was my bad and I shouldn't have done it. Get the fuck over it.
You're right, I didn't think about it clearly, my bad.

Thanks. Ah yeah I shouldn't have said that. It was a just a gimmick to make it feel more recent or fresh.
If I saw "I painted this last year" or "I just finished this painting"
what's more exciting? I know it was wrong but honestly don't feel so bad about it. I had no ill intentions behind it so forgive me.

http://imgur.com/unN9IN9
Sometimes I say I "just finished" it. Why is that a big deal? IT's my painting. So what if I finished it a year ago? does it matter?
Seems like you found out that you were wrong about accusing me and now just want to find something to pick at.
Why are you so worried about it?

everyone thinks their so damn clever.

WRITING.TITLE: My frustration pouring out. "Red and Black" Oil on Canvas

WRITING.TEXT: I didn't til you said but jeez what a sexy beast you have here
Thank you for the insight, I will be doing some thinking about that. I greatly appreciate your time. Thanks

Thank you, that really was insightful. I have been thinking about having a more concentrated portfolio and maybe I will choose a direction that is "me" and start making work along that. Thank you for the feedback.

thank you and yes! I started out using just the knife and then slowly figured out a way to be efficient with it. Since the palette knife takes a lot of paint, I started building the initial layers with a brush and as the layers thicken I was able to use the knife. It moved around much easier and the paint had better reaction to the surface because of the strong underlying foundations.
The landscapes are smaller, usually 8x10 canvases and for those I sometimes skipped building with a brush since I didn't need too much paint.

Thank you!! Here is more of my work.
www.ramandipsingh.com
